line_1: And more than once, (or Thou art much bely'd)
line_2: By Mars himself That Armour has been try'd.

line_1: The Evening has the Day bely'd;
You saw my Heart, how it my Tongue bely'd;
line_2: And when You press'd, how faintly I deny'd —

line_1: My Heart was by my Tongue bely'd;
line_2: How much I argu'd on your side.

line_1: What! are thy triumphs, sacred Truth, belied?
line_2: Why then hath Plato liv'd — or Sydney died?

line_1: When none the image of his God belied,
line_2: No Minions crouch'd beneath a Sultan's pride,
